CatDescriptText: Mr. Hurley Nance, 193 Burrows Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the police department states more raids in Negro neighborhoods than in white areas, because there is more crime in former districts?" answer reads: "It's possible that it's because of more after-hours joints, but I'm not certain."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Hurley Nance wearing fedora, moustache, and dark necktie with clip, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
